title.bibl: Forward, April 28, 1928. Twenty Thousand ($20,000) Dollars Raised at a Metting for Cooperative Cap Shop in Chicago.

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: The Jewish Daily Forward, April 28, 1928. TWENTY THOUSAND ($20,000) DOLLARS RAISED AT A METTING FOR COOPERATIVE CAP SHOP IN CHICAGO.

body.p: The local cap-makers, who are now on strike for quite sometime, will soon possess one of the strongest weapons to combat the bosses. They will, namely, be the owners of a cooperative cap shop.

A plan was drawn up, at the meeting of Cap Makers Local #5, Thursday, for the opening of a cooperative shop. Attorneys Fishbein and Sussman were present and they adjusted the legal side of the great enterprise.

For the success of this enterprise, a sum of $50,000 is required; $20,000 was raised at the meeting which confirms the assurance that this enterprise will be crowned with great success. Thirty thousand ($30,000) dollars are expected in two weeks.
